Yes, I do food distribution from time to time.  This weekend I did some baking for our houseless community.  Working in mutual aid is definitely how I find my people.  I've already staked out some groups in Colorado.
OMG Dumbo's Circus!  I hadn't thought about that in years!  It's weird that no one talks about it.  I used to love it haha. I can still sorta remember the theme song.

I think getting out of Florida will help a lot too.  There's not much here for me, especially in the way of nature.  I've been here for nearly 25 years and am kinda over swamps and beaches.  I long for the mountains and forest.

I am good about not working on weekends but I struggle with finding ways to occupy my time.  I hope one day to live by near a group of friends that can help alleviate this.  So many people seem so busy they don't have a moment to themselves so I feel a little guilty.  But mostly I feel very boring.

They attack all of these communities on the regular. It’s not one than the other. It’s all of us and it’s all happening now, particularly at intersectionality between communities. Black, Indigenous and people of color have always been at the forefront calling for action. Please remember this.

Wow...I mean, I am glad you are off them now, but makes me worried for my own prognosis.  Did you switch to another medication or just stop them all together?  I have gone through so many in the past few years and thought this might finally be "the one".  But not if this keeps up.

FUUUUUUCK.  Thank you SO much for your input.  I am definitely going to keep an eye on it because this is how I feel too.  I was so easily entertained before and now even making a conscious effort to add more variety still isn't making a dent.  Dammit.  I am SO sick of meds.

Im pretty sure I don’t have adhd at this point and I definitely wasn’t bored to this degree before the meds. Man, I sure hope it levels off. Dealing with side effects is the worst. Thank you for your input 💜

Has anyone here ever experienced extreme boredom in conjunction with mood stabilizers?  The med I am currently on has “restlessness” listed as a side effect and I am almost constantly bored lately. To the point it’s maddening. My isolation is part of it but I know the meds are affecting it too.

The brutal irony is that untreated ADHD is a barrier to full participation in a capitalist system, and yet that same system does its utmost to discourage and prevent treatment for ADHD because that would prove that mental health and chronic illness can be treated by medicine and not just will power.

My psychiatrist (not my therapist) doesn’t think I have adhd and from what I have learned so far, I am not convinced I do either. But not ruling it out at this point. I figure if nothing else, I will better learn how to help my adhd friends. 💜

Your beautiful neurodivergent brain deserves more than what it can receive from properly serving these gross ass systems we live under.
